sentences.en: A foolish woman is clamorous : she is simple , and knoweth nothing.
sentences.cn: 愚昧的妇人喧 囔.他是愚蒙,一无所知.

sentences.en: It has boisterous go - go bars, clamorous discos and tumultuous nightclubs.
sentences.cn: 那儿有喧闹的现代酒吧 、 迪斯科舞厅及过夜酒馆.

sentences.en: Pro 9:13 A foolish woman is clamorous : she is simple , and knoweth nothing.
sentences.cn: 箴9:13愚昧的妇人喧 囔.他是愚蒙,一无所知.

sentences.en: The clamorous hunger in his belly seemed to justify him.
sentences.cn: 他肚中的辘辘饥肠似乎就是他的理由.

sentences.en: The meeting began to become clamorous.
The silent night has the beauty of the mother and the clamorous day of child.
sentences.cn: 静夜有母亲的美,吵闹的白天有孩子的美.

sentences.en: The silent night has the beauty of the mother and the clamorous day of the chil.
sentences.cn: 静悄悄的黑夜具有母亲的美丽,而吵闹的白天具有孩子的美丽.

sentences.en: The silent night has the beauty of the mother and the clamorous day of the child.
sentences.cn: 静悄悄的黑夜具有母亲的美丽,而吵闹的白天具有孩子的美.

sentences.en: The waterfall seemed unusually clamorous too.
sentences.cn: 而瀑布也似乎分外的.向了.

sentences.en: There is always a clamorous din when I go to visit my father.
sentences.cn: 每当我去看视父亲的的时候，总有一个声音在那里大喊大叫。

sentences.en: They are clamorous for better pay.
sentences.cn: 他们吵吵嚷嚷要求增加工资.

words.tran_cn: 吵闹的；喧嚷的；紧急的；非常需要注意的
喧嚷，发喧嚣声；持续地喊声

trans.tran_cn: 喧嚷的，吵闹的，大声要求（或抗议）的，闹哄哄，聒噪
trans.tran_en: If you describe people or their voices as clamorous, you mean they are talking loudly or shouting
